author: .vbuterin
content: My main concern would be that it would make accounting more complicated and it would increase chain load

author: .vbuterin
content: Because it would require the chain to process 3 attestations per validator per epoch, instead of just 1

author: potuz
content: Also the first few blocks will not carry any on-chain votes for themselves as they will be filled with source-only votes that every validator will be submitting

author: potuz
content: If the upshot is to only propagate earlier and have the proposer at 12 to pick the latest message to include, then it wouldn't be do much of a trouble, we would not verify signature of the three attestations, we would gossip them and only verify the latest when it's included. Accounting wouldn't change much (again assuming what these messages can't be included in different blocks updating the full attestation, and the only intent is to propagate earlier)  so the main impact would be on the p2p stack I think
